titleStmt.title: Andrew Caldwell, Dublin, [Ireland], to James Edward Smith, Norwich, [Norfolk]

seriesStmt.ab: The Correspondence of Sir James Edward Smith, The Linnean Society's Archive Catalogue

sourceDesc.bibl: GB-110/JES/COR/3/23, The Linnean Society of London

abstract.p: The "Champion Potatoes" sent by Smith's mother from Norwich have been distributed and planted although have come up with both white and red blossoms, asks which is the true "Champion", Smith has annotated "the white is the right, orange stamina". Has been botanising with "Flora Britannica", approves that 'Cucubalus beken' is now 'Silene behen' but queries how it was determined. The only other plants he has seen are 'Draba verna' and either 'Fumaria capreolata' or 'Fumaria officinalis'. Believes the flower he sent previously was not 'Corolla supera' and therefore could not be either 'Galanthus' or 'Leucojum'. Suprised to find that 'Fumaria solida' and 'Fumaria lutea' are natives.
